de.undercouch.actson

Interface JsonFeeder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultJsonFeeder

    public interface JsonFeeder
    A feeder can be used to provide more input data to the JsonParser. The caller has to take care to only feed as much data as the parser can process at the time. Use isFull() to determine if the parser accepts more data. Then call feed(byte) or feed(byte[], int, int) until there is no more data to feed or until isFull() returns true. Next call JsonParser.nextEvent() until it returns JsonEvent.NEED_MORE_INPUT. Repeat feeding and parsing until all input data has been consumed. Finally, call done() to indicate the end of the JSON text.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void done()
      Call this method to indicate that the end of the JSON text has been reached and that there is no more input to parse.
      void feed(byte b)
      Provide more data to the JsonParser.
      int feed(byte[] buf)
      Provide more data to the JsonParser.

      char nextInput()
      Decode and return the next character to be parsed

    • Method Detail

      • feed

        void feed(byte b)
        Provide more data to the JsonParser. Should only be called if isFull() returns false.
        Parameters:
        b - the byte to provide as input to the parser
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the parser does not accept more input at the moment (see isFull())

      • feed

        int feed(byte[] buf)
        Provide more data to the JsonParser. The method will consume as many bytes from the input buffer as possible, either until all bytes have been consumed or until the feeder is full (see isFull()). The method will return the number of bytes consumed (which can be 0 if the parser does not accept more input at the moment).
        Parameters:
        buf - the byte array containing the data to consume
        Returns:
        the number of bytes consumed (can be 0 if the parser does not accept more input at the moment, see isFull())

      • feed

        int feed(byte[] buf,
         int offset,
         int len)
        Provide more data to the JsonParser. The method will consume as many bytes from the input buffer as possible, either until len bytes have been consumed or until the feeder is full (see isFull()). The method will return the number of bytes consumed (which can be 0 if the parser does not accept more input at the moment).
        Parameters:
        buf - the byte array containing the data to consume
        offset - the start offset in the byte array
        len - the number of bytes to consume
        Returns:
        the number of bytes consumed (can be 0 if the parser does not accept more input at the moment, see isFull())

      • isFull

        boolean isFull()
        Checks if the parser accepts more input at the moment. If it doesn't, you have to call JsonParser.nextEvent() until it returns JsonEvent.NEED_MORE_INPUT. Only then new input can be provided to the parser.
        Returns:
        true if the parser does not accept more input

      • done

        void done()
        Call this method to indicate that the end of the JSON text has been reached and that there is no more input to parse.

      • hasInput

        boolean hasInput()
          throws java.nio.charset.CharacterCodingException
        Determine if the feeder has input data that can be parsed
        Returns:
        true if the feeder has more input to be parsed
        Throws:
        java.nio.charset.CharacterCodingException - if the input data contains invalid characters

      • isDone

        boolean isDone()
        throws java.nio.charset.CharacterCodingException
        Check if the end of the JSON text has been reached
        Returns:
        true if the end of input has been reached
        Throws:
        java.nio.charset.CharacterCodingException - if the input data contains invalid characters

      • nextInput

        char nextInput()
        throws java.nio.charset.CharacterCodingException
        Decode and return the next character to be parsed
        Returns:
        the next character to be parsed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no input to parse
        java.nio.charset.CharacterCodingException - if the input data contains invalid characters
